VueJS.name: VueJS
VueJS.description: Progressive framework for building user interfaces in JavaScript. I have the most experience with this framework.

React.name: React
React.description: JavaScript library that helps create interactive user interfaces on websites.

Typescript.name: Typecript
Typescript.description: Extension of the JavaScript programming language that allows adding static typing to code.

HTML.name: HTML5
HTML.description: Standard markup language for creating the structure of web pages.

CSS.name: CSS3
CSS.description: Style language used for formatting web pages.

SCSS.name: SCSS
SCSS.description: CSS extension that adds additional features and syntactical capabilities for more convenient and structured styling.

VueX.name: VueX
VueX.description: Library for managing application state in Vue.js framework.

Vuerouter.name: Vue router
Vuerouter.description: Official routing library for Vue.js framework.

ARIA.name: ARIA
ARIA.description: ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) - a set of attributes for HTML and JavaScript aimed at improving web application accessibility for users with disabilities.

Responsive.name: Responsive
Responsive.description: Approach where a website is designed to automatically adapt and look optimal on various devices and screens, whether it's a computer, tablet, or smartphone.

Python.name: Python
Python.description: Popular and easily readable programming language.

Django.name: Django
Django.description: High-level framework for web development in the Python language.

PostgreSQL.name: PostgreSQL
PostgreSQL.description: Powerful and open-source database management system often used in web development.

DRF.name: Django REST Framework
DRF.description: An extension for the Django framework specifically designed for creating web services and APIs.

NextJS.name: NextJS
NextJS.description: Framework for building web applications based on React. It provides convenient tools for creating fast and scalable applications, including pre-rendering, routing, and server-side rendering, improving performance and user experience.

Figma.name: Figma
Figma.description: Online tool for designing interfaces, allowing the creation of layouts, prototypes, and real-time collaboration.

Photoshop.name: Adobe Photoshop
Photoshop.description: Software for editing and processing images.

Framer.name: Framer
Framer.description: Online tool for designing and prototyping interfaces.

NodeJS.name: NodeJS
NodeJS.description: Runtime environment that allows running JavaScript code on the server, not just in the browser.

Git.name: Git
Git.description: Distributed version control system that helps web developers track changes in code, collaborate with other developers, and manage project history.

Puppetteer.name: Puppetteer
Puppetteer.description: A set of tools for automating interactions with web pages. Web developers can use Puppeteer to create scripts that can open browsers, navigate pages, perform actions like form filling, and extract data, which is useful, for example, for testing and web scraping.

DiscordAPI.name: Discord API
DiscordAPI.description: A set of interfaces and methods provided by Discord, a communication platform. Web developers can use this API to create bots and integrations, enabling automation of actions, managing messages, and interacting with users on Discord servers.

Vercel.name: Vercel
Vercel.description: Cloud platform that allows developers to deploy and host web applications and sites.

Jest.name: Jest
Jest.description: Popular framework for testing JavaScript code.

YandexCloud.name: Yandex Cloud
YandexCloud.description: Cloud platform providing infrastructure and services for deploying, hosting, and scaling web applications and services.

Midjourney.name: Midjourney
Midjourney.description: Neural network that generates images based on textual descriptions.

ChatGPT.name: ChatGPT
ChatGPT.description: An artificial intelligence model capable of generating textual responses based on user input.

Discord bot: Discord bot for our community server
